reviews.review:
I will start off this review with a very honest statement: This is going to be very bias. When I look back at the past 25 years of gaming I have experienced, this is easily the most standout of all time, across all platforms. It's influence is unparalleled. If there is any part of the game that may feel dated, that's simply because the FPS genre has evolved so much the past 18 years and you can thank this game for it. It's the Citizen Kane of videogames and I will never listen to anyone tell me otherwise. 

With it being an older game I feel like I can't rate it using my normal system, so it's going to get an overal of 10/10 and that's that. I'd recommend the source version of the game but with or without the engine it's absolutely perfect.
A 1998 game that can be played in 1080p?  Awsome!
I love this game for it's oldness. Turn off the bilinear filter to enjoy some PS1-style graphics, also, get Crack-Life, it's a pretty good mod.

''You play as a mute theoretical physicist with a crowbar fetish''-steam user 
''20 minutes into the game, got killed by a bookcase. 10/10''-steam user 

As you can see all the good things in gaming. But seriously I think that this game is a must own if you use steam or call yourself a gamer.

not much more to say than this game is incredible, nearly perfect. The graphics aren't the best but you have to expect that from a game that came out in 1998. there are a few minor bugs but nothing game breaking or too annoying.
:D

(my lack of hours on the game is due to me playing the game here, then beating it on source.)

Half Life.  It's a good game. Derr.

I am playing HL2 right now, and I'm glad I played HL1 first. If you are planning on playing the Half Life series, play it in the following order.

Half Life (source or goldsrc)
Half Life Opposing Force
Half Life Blue Shift
Half Life 2
Half Life 2 Episode 1
Half Life 2 Episode 2

It's a good game, and holds up even today. You will get stuck, as the school system doesn't teach people like they used to. I used a walkthrough to get past parts I couldn't figure out. I give you permission to do the same.

isnt that's İncredible ?(my super heros wasnt Batman spider man etc. it was truely gordon)

伟大的半条命，经典永恒。
在人们吐槽L4D2撬棍的时候，不知有谁知道这个梗来自于我大弗里曼地上最强兵器——撬棍呢？
Better than cockatoos!
Um lixo, mas é bom.

10/10

Easily one of the best games i have ever played. If you look past the slightly dated graphics and the somewhat janky physics, you get to experience the greatest FPS games of our time. Valve should take a look back at the original installment when making HL3 (if it ever happens). The way the sheer and utter confusion of the incident is conveyed by not giving the player any info about what actualy happened isn't overdone so you feel lost, but wanting to find out even more. A masterclass in storyteling which i expect to find in HL2 when i play it.

Once again, 10/10 would recommend to anyone i meet. Well done, Valve
good game, good memories

Obrigação de quem é fã da valve, jogar e zerar este jogo. Apesar de ter gráficos do ano 2000, tem uma sequencia de história muito lógica e envolvente. A sequencia dos half-life's também é interessante jogar. Este jogo jamais morrerá.
Fun game at first with hilerious physics, however it is very repetitive and the level designs are very confusing.  Would not recommend this game.
Классика и счастливое детство :D

21/12/2020 Review: I never actually got very far in this game at all when I was younger - simply because it never intrigued me enough and I found it too hard. But coming back to it 5 years after that review, and 7 years after I bought it, I decided to finally play the whole thing from start to finish, and it took me 12.5 hours. What an incredible game. Not quite as good as Half-Life 2, but I'm really glad I played this as I can now say I've played all the main Half-Life games (apart from HL:Alyx, of course). Despite the game being 22 years old, it is still incredibly enjoyable if you like fast paced, strategic and first person gameplay. It's really interesting to get a feel for what the Source Engine was developed from, and seriously insane to see the things that a game company like VALVe were capable of creating in the late 90s. There is no doubt that this game changed the gaming industry as a whole - and I would definitely recommend playing it IF you're a Half-Life 2 fan, or just enjoy a good journey.

Original Review: Ya know... the feeling when you're in a vent and a Head Crab comes flying at your face.
10/10 -Zouty "Still scarier than FNAF"
Stop reading this review and get it.
Falling will be your best friend...
Good Game But... Uses an Outdated Engine (Goldsource) That i'm Not suited for.

I Wanted to play this game for a long while but had to wait over 3 years before I could get a computer of my own to properly play it.  Thankfully the 3 year wait was worth it, for Half-Life was everything I wanted it to be.  I still prefer Half-Life 2 as it has the characters and simple yet compelling story along with the action, but Half-Life's action is so satisfying you don't need anything else (apart from Freeman of course) to happily continue the story.  A definite favourite FPS of mine along with Bioshock, Call of Duty 2, and Return to Castle Wolfenstein!

Half-Life. Just, Half-Life. What can I say about this game? That it revolutionized the world of First-Person Shooters? That it is the game that single-handedly put Valve Software on the map of game companies? That it is a remarkable classic that nobody should ever have absent from their hard drive? Naw. Without looking at the reviews already written for this game, I can guarantee that all of these topics have already been discussed in detail. Just play it. Don't let your dreams be dreams.
O game agora sei o quanto ele foi importante para o universo game, para mim um dos melhores jogo que ja jogue vale cada centavos.

El Famosisimo Juego que yo jugaba en el cyber de mi barrio Volvio con todo!
siempre cuando iba al cyber el unico juego que jugaba era este....y simepre me preguntaba ¿COMO SE LLAMA ESTE PERSONAJE??? YA CASI 17 AÑOS QUE SIGO JUGANDO ESTE JUEGO UNA Y OTRA VEZ.....

In one word -BOSS! This is the absolute bees knees when it comes to old school FPS. There is nothing quite like it! If I could give it a 11/10 I would. Easily the most fun I have had over the years on pretty much any game.

你喜欢什么样的的游戏？是 角色扮演 还是第一人称射击？ 或者 恐怖解密，做一个指挥官？像星际争霸指挥作战？
无论你喜欢什么，这个游戏都可以满足你的要求，主角是半条命的基本。扮演一个美国最帅，全世界最帅的虚拟英雄主角，无所不能的强大， 你可以替代任何角色的位置，做到任何角色可以做到的，弗里曼的潜力是无限的，（冒险 ，正义，强大），这些经典品质映射了千千万万的主角！无论你想在游戏里做什么，输或赢，你永远一腔热血，就像戈登弗里曼的精神。

这款游戏最让人痴迷的魅力不是紧张刺激的战斗，也不是故事跌宕的情节，而是其他游戏都不具备的———角色！有了角色，你会发现你的游戏生涯发生了天翻地覆的改变！

尽情享受这个游戏之王吧

Великолепно воспринимается даже спустя 17 лет после выхода. Практически все идеи, впервые реализованные в Half-Life, до сих пор находят применение в гораздо более современных проектах. Кроме того игра (между прочим, вовсе не короткая) не дает заскучать ни на секунду, подрасывая все новые и новые ситуации. Потрясающе!

História: 10

Dei nota 10, por ser um bom e velho gráfico no ano de 1998. Quem sentiu saudade naquela época... vai sentir muita nostalgia.

I got this game because it was on sale. I honestly didn't think I'd like it. I've heard a lot about the Half-Life franchise, mostly people pining away for another installment. I thought Half-Life 1 was just a game that was ahead of its time when it was released and got a very dedicated fanbase. Then I started playing it. I always give any game I buy a try, even if only a few minutes. But I quickly found myself enjoying it so thoroughly that time stopped being an issue. It didn't matter that hours were going by playing a game I was ready to brush off. Now I'm eager to finish this installment and continue on the the next.
its alright

It's fun, butt their sure is alot of backtracking, in one part you have to turn on a power generator and dodge claws from 3 whole monster's that you cant kill. And once you do kill them you have to jump into the hole they came from. The beginning of the game is shockin, in a good way though. It's atmospheric, creepy, and it makes you feel very alone. You witness people get brutally murdered, kill creepy creatures, and cause a chain reaction in an expeiriment. the game is also really challenging. the enemy's are really hard to kill, and you have to worry about the ammo you have. The good thing is you don't need to play this before playing half-life 2, which is a game I strongly reccomend. But that doesnt mean I dont reccomend this game. I just have to play it because I've beaten each installment in the second games series. I DO reccomend this game, but it's not as good as the second in my opinion. It's a little repetitive, you face one wall then have to go back somewhere to find the solution to killing it, or you have to turn on some sort of power generator and stuff. just buy iy

[h1] HALF-LIFE [h1]

Encarna a un prometedor científico llamado Gordon Freeman, colócate el traje de protección y. . . [b] Prepárate para consecuencias imprevistas... [b]

[h1] Pros, porque contras no existen <3 [h1]

* Gráficos al puro estilo de la vieja escuela.
* Banda sonora sin igual.
* Jugabilidad intuitiva, si no te gusta alguna tecla ¡Cambiala!
* Un juego que narra la historia como nunca antes lo a echo un videojuego.
* Juegalo una y otra vez, ¡Y nunca te aburriras! 100% Re-Jugable.
* No hay cortes, scripts, ni ninguna basura de esas, ¡TU ERES EL QUE JUEGA! 
* Inmersión total.

10/10

It's Half-Life. I believe that's all I really need to say.

While I don't believe the original has aged as well as it's incredible sequels, this is still an incredibly fun FPS with interesting story and lore. Gameplay wise it's also still incredibly fun with some of the weapons you get (flesh-eating aliens, a powerful crowbar, and highly unstable test weapons anyone?), and exploring Black Mesa really sets it apart from the other FPSes at the time. Furthermore, it really helped revolutionize the FPS genre by having more "natural" level design than other FPSes that really makes it feel as if you're exploring a research facility falling apart.

There's also the incredible fan-made remake Black Mesa which I've heard very good things about (and it's now on Steam!), but the game's final chapter currently isn't finished yet. If you're impatient like me, you might want to just purchase the original and play the game. Besides, I've heard a lot of people say you can appreciate Black Mesa more if you've finished the original!

Игра на века.10/10
Nostalgic with my old PC.

Half life est un classique, tout aussi bon que son successeur, et ayant bénéficié d'une communauté tenace de moddeurs et de speedrunners qui ont contribué à augmenter substantiellement la durée de vie du jeu.

L'ambiance globale est très réussie, sombre, solitaire. L'environnement et l'histoire sont énigmatiques mais laissent une grande liberté d'interprétation pour le joueur, et d'anticipation pour les développeurs eux-même. Il suffit de voir à quel point Half-life 2 a un scénario qui, a priori, se détache de celui de son prédécesseur.

C'est la marque de fabrique des jeux de Valve en solo, et je pense à Portal tout particulièrement (dans le même univers qu'Half-Life par ailleurs) : l'histoire sert l'environnement du jeu en étant discrète, ce qui permet l'élaboration d'un monde particulièrement attachant, constitué de beaucoup de questions sans réponses.

Au niveau du gameplay, on a des phases de logique jamais frustrantes, des phases de tir parfois relativement difficiles mais incroyablement satisfaisantes, agrémentées d'un IA surprenante pour l'époque dans le bon sens du terme, et une exploitation variée des différents environnements du jeu (je pense notamment aux derniers niveaux). Les ennemis sont assez variés et la courbe de difficulté, bien qu'un peu saillante sur certains passages, reste abordable au commun des mortels. J'ai joué au jeu en intermédiaire pour la première expérience, et en difficile les fois suivantes. 

Graphiquement, le jeu n'a pas si mal vieilli. Je n'ai pas trop cherché de mod pour des meilleures textures et ça ne m'intéresse pas outre mesure, mais il tourne très bien, est bardé de détails, et les graphismes n'empêchent pas du tout l'immersion.

 Il ne faut pas être dérangé par ces vieux graphismes ni par la difficulté ( vraiment toute relative, mais qui diminue le panel des joueurs qui arrivent jusqu'au bout). Au final, on a un jeu substantiellement impeccable, très innovant, toujours original même aujourd'hui, avec une bonne rejouabilité, et particulièrement agréable.

Et je vous conseille un mod précis : half-life zombie, sur cette page http://www.moddb.com/mods/half-life-zombie-edition, qui m'a occupé pendant 2 ou 3 heures.

Бла-бла-бла, много букв.

Давным давно, когда на тему третьей части ещё никто не ныл, когда большинство пользователей стима ещё даже в школу не ходили, была выпущена Half-Life. И всё в ней тогда было замечательно - и сюжет, и геймплей, и графика, и вообще. Игра сразу заработала множество всяких наград, 40 изданий назвали её игрой года, а некоторые - лучшей игрой за всю историю. И вполне заслуженно.

Итак, что же такого в этой игре? Как известно, игра вышла в конце далёкого 1998 года. Главное, чем на тот момент поразила Half-Life - это графика. Модели выглядели просто замечательно, текстурки были хороши, и, что самое интересное - игра вполне себе хорошо шла на большинстве домашних компьютеров того времени. Но не забывайте: Half-Life - это не Срузис, игра держится не только на одной лишь графике. 

Атмосфера. В Half-Life это далеко не пустой звук. Valve умело передали картину и настроение тех мест, в которых побывал Гордон. Это не какие-нибудь массовки с декорациями, как в других играх, а действительно настоящая атмосфера. Сложно передать словами то чувство, когда минут 10 блуждал по вентиляциям в надежде найти выход, а потом смотришь на эту вентиляцию со стороны.

Также достойны внимания сюжет и метод его подачи. Valve придумали нестандартный на тот момент метод подачи сюжета игроку: всю игру мы следим за историей глазами одного местного учёного, звать которого Гордон Фримен. Сценарий таков: накатавшись на вагоничках, включа сигнализацию и испортив еду в микроволновке, Гордон приступает к участию в суперсерьезном суперэксперименте с кристаллом из другого мира в суперсекретной лаборатории Black Mesa. По канонам жанра всё идёт "ну как-то не так": через новообразовавшийся телепорт из другого мира появляются эмигранты, стремящиеся навести здесь свои порядки. Правительство это не радует, после чего оно посылает в лабораторию армию - убить пришельцев и учёных заодно, чтобы никому не разболтали об этом инциденте. Фримену предстоит выбраться из Black Mesa, отстреливая военных и местную флору/фауну. Teh end. Да, сейчас сюжет может показаться весьма обыденным, но тогда, после "кто-то, где-то, зачем-то" игр, как Quake и Doom, сценарий Лэйдлоу смотрелся более, чем хорошо.

Высокий уровень взаимодействия с окружающим миром - в игре можно безнаказанно включать сигнал тревоги в мирное время, портить еду в микроволновке, направлять авиаудар на самого себя и даже выключать свет в комнате! Развлекаться можно не только пострелушками.

Персонажи. Да знаю я, что полноценных персонажа всего два, но они тоже хороши. Играем мы за одного из них - Гордон Фримен, в свои 27 он является доктор философии. Полностью молчит, что вначале позиционировалось как способ большего углубления игрока в игру. Второй - G-Man, тот самый человек с синим чумаданом, который всё время появляется в разных моментах игры. Определённо что-то знает, но молчит. Стесняется, наверное. За что и любим.

Ну что ж, пора подвести итог. Игра замечательна, как ни крути. Так называемый "Must have" для всех любителей шутеров. 
Оценка: 10 из 10.

P.S. Я так и не нашёл места для шутки про Гейба, так уж извините.

It's a half-life game.

The game that started it all.

[i][b]Это не обзор, можно ставить дизлайк ;) [/b] [/i]

[b][h1]Студии Valve снова удалось всех поразить! Мы долго ждали её и надеялись, но  ожидая её мы забыли про другое продолжение не менее легендарной серии. Вот пришло время, наши умельцы совершили прорыв и выпустили Half-Life3:Last portal. Новая графика созданная благодаря движку Source 2. Долгожданное окончание шикарной истории не только серии Half-Life, но и серии Portal. Но самое главное в игре, это геймплей. Здесь Valve превзошли самих себя. Теперь Аликс будет по настоящему живая и иметь в своем арсенале портальную пушку, с которой будет вам помогать при преодолении сложнейших препятствий, а так же в бою. Но ещё мы можем переключить камеру на Аликс и указывать ей что делать. А взять двоих игроков с огромным арсеналом, портальными пушками и отправит блуждать по огромным картам… Просто потрясающий кооператив! А также мультиплеер с другими новыми фишками… Эх, а открытый мир в сюжетной компании…  Это новая легенда! Жаль, что вам придется ещё немножко подождать анонса(2 года), и релиза(+1 год).

Ой, это же обзор первой части… Хмм, что же сказать? Ну, мне вас жалко, если вы ещё не прошли первую часть, вы должны это сделать немедленно. И я вам гарантирую, что вы получите массу удовольствия. [/h1][/b]

El Antecesor de Half Life 2 y el que generó toda esta moda de los Shooters en aquellos tiempos, Te Encantará y te traerá recuerdos de tu vida de pequeño cuando juegues a este juego.

td;dr   I bought this as part of a bundle of everything Half Life. Not worth it, in terms of gameplay and plot.

Playing Half Life makes me really appreciate the huge strides that technology and the gaming industry have made. Not to diss on it, because I understand that this game had made great contributions to gaming, but 5 hours into the game, I'm tearing my hair out because of the controls. It's unbearable. I can't jump high enough, climbing ladders are a complete chore, tight-roping across pipes often leads Freeman to fall to his death...  There were so little directions I often find myself wondering where should I go, what to do, and what actually happened. The graphics were expectedly outdated so perhaps playing its remake, Half-Life: Source, would be a better alternative, one that I missed but was within the buddle. Too late now I suppose. I wouldn't want to replay the first 5 hours again. 

I have given up on finishing the game. I'm even considering skipping the expansions and hop on YouTube to watch the playthroughs instead. Maybe I'll install them and try them out. But I'd definitely give Half Life 2 a try.

EDIT: turns out I can jump into Chapter 7 for HL:S. Maybe I'll give it a try!

For those who told me to "git gud," I can honestly tell everyone that it's not worth it, personally speaking. I'm not one of those haughty gamers with great eye-hand coordination, or those who would choose to spend a lot of time gitting gud at maneuvering in old games but I've played my fair share of games, and if I still couldn't get used to these deficiencies, 5 hours in, I don't plan on improving - improving my skill of adapting to obsolete technology, skills that are not transferable, going forward. Even if I factor in the gameplay and plot in those hours, which are dull, and dull by today's standards, it's not worth it.

This game is something that I only recently saw (unfortunate, because it is such a good game), but it is something that I would recommend to anyway either loves first-person-shooter games or wanting to get into first-person-shooters, or just someone who wants a new game. As of today (June 30th, 2015), I have played about 21 hours. It has a storyline that is both good and just plain awesome. Honestly, it doesn't have the BEST graphics, but the NPCs/enemys have good models, i think.

But, I ABSOLUTELY RECOMMEND THIS GAME! And when I finish this game, I am ABSOLUTELY going to get Half-Life 2 (if I have the money). *starts singing the "Everything is Awesome" song from The Lego Movie*
10 из 10 зомби пялющих в комп.

One day a timer will appear on the Steam front page.
No one knows it's purpose and Valve will remain silent as usual.
For days people speculate that the announcement of Half Life 3 is imminent.
When the timer reaches the last few seconds, it freezes on the number 3. For a moment nothing happens and the world watches in anticipation.
Suddenly Gabe Newell's face appears on the screen.
"Valve is proud to announce a long anticipated game from a series that the fans have been excited to return to for many years."
He pauses for a moment and smiles, "It was worth the weight."
Suddenly, men and women all over the world have earth shattering orgasms, all diseases are cured, world hunger is solved, and all wars instantly come to an end.
"I am pleased to announce Ricochet 2."
This game is so legendary! 5/5

I'm not a huge fan of first person shooters, but I always loved Half-Life and all of its sequels. The game possesses a constant atmosphere of adventure and mystery, and the game is always making you guess what might be lurking around the next corner. It has an involving story and many different game mechanics that are fun and easy to use throughout the entire game. It really feels like you're inside the Black Mesa facility and it's definitely a game worth your time.

(Also, you might see that I have 52 hours in this game so far. This game takes about 12 hours on average to complete. Yeah, I really like this game.)

The Shooter companion to Mario 64. Inspired future FPS titles.
Pros:
-Good puzzles
-Great gameplay mechanics
-Amazing level design
Cons:
-Some parts are quite confusing, like that kraken-thing in Blast Pit.
-Annoying, and pretty frustrating platforming. 
-Why can you freely kill friendly npcs at any time?
